page.title: 14SILAGE,Shortacombe,Yeoford.
page.content: When we went silaging at{Shortacombe {Farm}we got there by mini bus. First we looked at the silage pit or clamp. Then we looked at the forage harvester and we were told how it worked. It picks up grass, then it is chopped up and comes out as a spout and goes into a trailer which is hitched behind. When the trailer is full a tractor and empty trailer comes and the empty trailer takes the place of the full trailer. The tractor and full trailer go to the pit to empty. When the trailer is emptied the buck rake pushes the grass into the pit. The empty trailer goes to the forage harvester and it happens all over again. The mower conditioner cuts the grass and snaps it and squeezes some of the sap out. The silage is used to feed cows, bullocks and bulls in the winter time.
